decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling the powerful Amulet Titan combo by utilizing cards like Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor to generate explosive mana and land ramp. The key strategy involves tutoring for key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and The Mycosynth Gardens to deal massive damage and overwhelm the opponent. With the ability to tutor for important pieces using cards like Expedition Map and Tolaria West, the deck aims to quickly ramp up and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful land synergies and combo potential.

The deck focuses on using a diverse range of cards from different colors to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key concept is to maintain a fast tempo by consistently playing threats and disrupting the opponent's strategies while utilizing the companion card, Jegantha, the Wellspring, for additional value. By efficiently utilizing resources and leveraging the synergies between the cards in the deck, it aims to quickly outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo quickly by using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Urza's Saga. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with land tutors like Explore and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, as well as bounce lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber. By utilizing lands that produce multiple mana and have strong abilities, the deck can generate massive amounts of mana to cast powerful threats like Primeval Titan and eventually overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration for card advantage and Underworld Breach for graveyard recursion. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional mana ramp and versatility. The deck is designed to be aggressive and efficient, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This Modern 4c Control deck focuses on using a variety of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Nissa, along with removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt, to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Solitude and Elesh Norn to establish board presence and close out the game. With a versatile mana base and access to a range of powerful cards, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on playing small artifact creatures and using cards like Hardened Scales to increase their power and toughness, allowing for fast and aggressive plays. It also includes ways to protect your creatures, such as Welding Jar, and has a few unique cards like Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp and The Ozolith to provide additional support and synergies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with efficient creatures and powerful interactions, making it a formidable threat in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo involving Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature, allowing for a win condition and a way to out-grind opponent decks. With cards like Auriok Champion and Arbor Elf providing additional support, and Collected Company to search for combo pieces, the deck aims to quickly set up its combo while controlling the board with cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos. The mana base is optimized for consistency and efficiency, allowing for a smooth execution of the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and put into play using cards like Chord of Calling, in order to create powerful combos and synergies. The deck aims to control the board with creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and use cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Blood Artist to drain the opponent's life total. The inclusion of various creature types and abilities allows for flexibility in gameplay and the ability to adapt to different situations.

The deck focuses on using Urza and various artifacts to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes cards like Stoneforge Mystic to tutor for key artifacts such as Sword of the Meek and Thopter Foundry, creating a strong board presence. Additionally, cards like Esper Sentinel and Portable Hole help to control the opponent's plays while Urza's Saga generates additional value. The deck aims to establish a strong defense while slowly gaining advantage through incremental advantages and powerful artifact synergies.

The deck focuses on utilizing mill strategies to force the opponent to draw cards from an empty library, ultimately winning the game through deck depletion. It includes cards like Archive Trap, Fractured Sanity, Hedron Crab, and Ruin Crab to mill the opponent's library quickly, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Drown in the Loch and Fatal Push. The deck also includes Tasha's Hideous Laughter and Surgical Extraction to further disrupt the opponent's strategy and remove key cards from their library. The goal is to control the game while milling the opponent out as quickly as possible.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressively and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Grief. It also includes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to quickly threaten the opponent. The deck utilizes a mix of removal spells like Terminate and Lightning Bolt to control the board while maintaining pressure. Additionally, cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Not Dead After All provide additional value and resilience to the deck. The goal is to win the game through a combination of early aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on cycling through its cards to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. It also utilizes cards like Architects of Will and Curator of Mysteries to manipulate the top of the deck and ensure a successful combo. The deck includes counter spells like Force of Negation and Subtlety to protect the combo, and creatures like Generous Ent and Endurance to disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden flurry of powerful creatures brought back from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on using cards like Indomitable Creativity and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to quickly and unexpectedly summon powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty. By utilizing a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, along with disruption cards like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own combo win condition. The inclusion of cards like Persist and Transmogrify adds further versatility and creativity to the deck, allowing for unexpected and powerful plays to secure victory.
